get.summary: Gets the closest block of the provided date

parameters.description: The chain to query

parameters.name: providerUrl
parameters.description: web3 provider url to user when using local dev chain

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Unix date in miliseconds or a datestring (any format that is accepted by momentjs)

200.description: Returns the blocknumber and corresponding date and timestamp

get.summary: Gets address logs

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The chain to query

parameters.name: subdomain
parameters.description: The subdomain of the moralis server to use (Only use when selecting local devchain as chain)

parameters.name: block_number
parameters.description:
The block number
* Provide the param 'block_numer' or ('from_block' and / or 'to_block')
* If 'block_numer' is provided in conbinaison with 'from_block' and / or 'to_block', 'block_number' will will be used

parameters.name: from_block
parameters.description:
The minimum block number from where to get the logs
* Provide the param 'block_numer' or ('from_block' and / or 'to_block')
* If 'block_numer' is provided in conbinaison with 'from_block' and / or 'to_block', 'block_number' will will be used

parameters.name: to_block
parameters.description:
The maximum block number from where to get the logs
* Provide the param 'block_numer' or ('from_block' and / or 'to_block')
* If 'block_numer' is provided in conbinaison with 'from_block' and / or 'to_block', 'block_number' will will be used

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description:
The date from where to get the logs (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.
* If 'from_date' and the block params are provided, the block params will be used. Please refer to the blocks params sections (block_number,from_block and to_block) on how to use them

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description:
Get the logs to this date (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.
* If 'to_date' and the block params are provided, the block params will be used. Please refer to the blocks params sections (block_number,from_block and to_block) on how to use them

parameters.description: address

parameters.description: topic2

parameters.name: topic3
parameters.description: topic3

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor returned in the last response (for getting the next page)

get.description: Gets the logs from an address

200.description: Returns the logs of an address

get.summary: Gets the NFTs owned by a given address

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The chain to query

parameters.description: The owner of a given token

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the token id

parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The addresses to get balances for (Optional)

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor returned in the last response (for getting the next page)

get.description:
Gets NFTs owned by the given address
* The response will include status [SYNCED/SYNCING] based on the contracts being indexed.
* Use the token_address param to get results for a specific contract only
* Note results will include all indexed NFTs
* Any request which includes the token_address param will start the indexing process for that NFT collection the very first time it is requested

200.description: Returns a collection of nft owners

get.summary: Retrieves the NFT data based on a metadata search

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The chain to query

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the token id

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The search string

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: What fields the search should match on. To look into the entire metadata set the value to 'global'. To have a better response time you can look into a specific field like name

parameters.name: from_block
parameters.description:
The minimum block number from where to start the search
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

parameters.name: to_block
parameters.description:
The maximum block number from where to end the search
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description:
The date from where to start the search (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description:
Get search results up until this date (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

parameters.name: addresses
parameters.description: The addresses to get metadata for

parameters.name: token_address
parameters.description: token_address

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: cursor

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit

get.description: Gets NFTs that match a given metadata search.

200.description: Returns the matching NFTs

200.description: Returns a collection NFT collections.

get.summary: resync the metadata for a given token_id

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The chain to query

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of the contract

parameters.name: token_id
parameters.description: The id of the token

parameters.name: flag
parameters.description: The type of resync to operate

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: To define the behaviour of the endpoint

get.description:
ReSync the metadata for an NFT
* The metadata flag will request a the NFT's metadata from the already existing token_uri
* The uri(default) flag will fetch the latest token_uri from the given NFT address. In sync mode the metadata will also be fetched
* The sync mode will make the endpoint synchronous so it will wait for the task to be completed before responding
* The async mode(default) will make the endpoint asynchronous so we will wait for the task to be completed before responding

200.description: (In sync mode) Resync request executed.

202.description: The resync request was received and will be executed.

404.description: (In sync mode) Resync request executed and metadata could not be updated.

get.description: Resolves an ETH address and find the ENS name

200.description: Returns an ENS

get.summary: Get liquidity pair reserves for an Uniswap V2 based Exchange.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The chain to query

parameters.name: to_block
parameters.description: To get the reserves at this block number

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description:
Get the reserves to this date (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

parameters.name: provider_url
parameters.description: web3 provider url to user when using local dev chain

parameters.name: pair_address
parameters.description: Liquidity pair address

get.description: Get the liquidity reserves for a given pair address. Only Uniswap V2 based exchanges supported at the moment.

200.description: Returns the pair reserves

get.summary: Get pair address based on token0 and token1 address

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The chain to query

parameters.name: to_block
parameters.description: To get the reserves at this block number

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description:
Get the reserves to this date (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

parameters.name: exchange
parameters.description: The factory name or address of the token exchange

parameters.name: token0_address
parameters.description: Token0 address

parameters.name: token1_address
parameters.description: Token1 address

get.description:
Fetches and returns pair data of the provided token0+token1 combination.
The token0 and token1 options are interchangable (ie. there is no different outcome in "token0=WETH and token1=USDT" or "token0=USDT and token1=WETH")

200.description: Returns the pair address of the two tokens

post.summary: Uploads multiple files and place them in a folder directory

requestBody.description: Array of JSON and Base64 Supported

post.description: Uploads multiple files and place them in a folder directory

200.description: Returns the path to the uploaded files

get.summary: Returns the web3 api version

200.description: Returns the web3 api version

get.summary: Returns the endpoint price list for rate limits and costs

200.description: Returns the endpoint price list for rate limits and costs
